column9: I have been taking endocet for a while now with no problems or side affects I have arthritis all through me & I take 3 pills a day & I have really bad days when it rains & I believe that on those days that even my hair hurts, when it rains like it is doing out now I just want to crawl in a nut shell & stay there because it hurts so much. I Thank God that I have a wonderful doctor that sits down with me & hears what I am telling her, I have been to other drs. that aren`t listening to what I am telling them & it seems like they are just hurrying me out the door but my dr. is very understanding & helps me, I could not function each day without this medicine. I hurt 24/7 everywhere on me & I cannot say enough about how this medicine lets me have a life. The pain never goes away completely but the medicine works well enough that I can function & get through the day. Everybodys system is different & it works differently for everyone. It took a few tries with other medicine before my dr. found the one that works gooder for me & I am thankful she worked with me until we did find the right one.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Shark45, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking 10/325mg 8x/day for about a year now. I've had over 13 major surgerie, need a left shoulder replacement, right knee replacement and have had numerous other procedures to my back.  I have major lower back issues and continue to have them.  I've had L4/L5, L5/S1 fused and they put a transition segment at L3/L4 to help support it with rods and pins.  I'm on the path to having L2/L3 fused possibly, but we're trying different options.  I'm also on Embeda(80mg) but now switching over to Exalgo(16mg) for my long acting pain meds along with taking Lyrica and Valium, a stool softner and testoterone shots.  I have to say, for the breakthrough pain, Percocet(Endocet) works the best for me, but is hard to find.  They are using Oxycodone w/ Acetametaphine, but I specifically order Endocet as the Oxycodone for some reason does not work for me.  I would highly recommend this for those that need severe breakthrough pain meds, but be careful, it has different effects on everyone.  I can funtion almost normally with no side effects, but other people get drowsy and have issues.  This med coupled with my other meds seems to help to a point, but only get my pain level down to a 4 (1-10, 10 being the worse) at best, but usually averages around a 6 and goes up to a 7-8.  I'm also looking into getting the new oxycontin when it comes out at the end of this year.  I have a great pain management doctor here in NJ that really knows his stuff.  Good luck to everyone with pain issues...it's tough to go through.

column2: shellbee , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used this drug after knee surgery but was unable to go to the bathroom after using it for 3 days. Stopped using it and would not recommend this drug to anyone! the pain in my stomach was much worse than the pain in my knee.

column2: becareful, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: PLEASE READ ALL OF THIS!!!  BE CAREFUL with the drug (and other oxycodone drugs).  I started taking oxycodon 2.5/325 a year ago because I had a car accident as needed.  I was very good at following my doc's orders with physical therapy, stretching, etc.  Never missed an appointment and only took medication as needed. I'm well educated in science/medicine.  I have a PhD and I've always been a health nut, at the gym 4 days a week, ate well(mostly organic foods). I now take 6-8 10/325 endocet a day!  I called out sick from work for the past week and have had terrible depression and anxiety trying to stop taking it.  I've seen both my doctor and a psychiatrist about this.  It all stems from my gradual overuse of this medication for legitimate pain.  I no longer work out.  I have lost my girlfriend of 5 years.  I have wasted my savings and barely go to work anymore.  This is a very dangerous drug and it's addictiveness sneaks up on you.  Please, please don't ruin your life by taking this medication like I have.  Take vicodin.  It works just as well but is less addictive.

column2: greatfulforendocet, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had severe back pain for years and have tried everything from epidural injections to therapy but without surgery I was beginning to get frustrated with vicodin or lortab, celebrex, tramadol or other pain relivers. There is a risk of chemical dependency due to the opioid in the medication, but used in moderation and never more than reccomended it was fine. Also don't take it for more than a few months and try alternate meds to prevent building a tolerance. Overall I am pleased with this medication and finally feel relief from the daily agony that was just about to send me into the emergency room for in-patient help.

column2: bgracegirl321, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had chronic pain for 9 years due to an injury to my right leg/knee. My doctor placed me on this medication and it provided relief. Recently, I have been placed on a second, long-acting opioid along with Percocet to keep the pain away for longer periods of time and I have become somewhat tolerant to Percocet. I would recommend it for people needing a pain reliever for shorter periods of time, i.e. dental surgery, surgery, broken bones, etc. as I have found that many people I have talked to that also take this medication have become tolerant to it, but it is a very good pain reliever.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am disappointed with Endocet . I take oxycodone for migraine pain and usually get the generic 10/325's.  The last time I went to a new pharmacy which only carries Endocet.  He assured me that Endocet was manufactured by the company which makes the brand name Percocet, so I assumed it would work the same as the other generics.  I was wrong.  It does nothing for my pain.  I may as well just take aspirin.  I told the pharmacist it did not work and he said politely that it was my imagination.  I know pain when I feel it and Endocet provides no relief.  The next time my doctor prescribes oxycodone I'll make sure the pharmacy which fills it does not use this product.

column2: 75 or over on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
aled24fl, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have chronic low back pain from a car accident and it was a really bad one to where the tire was on top of the motor. I have been to pain management and ciroprators and that didn't work also I have tried everything from vicodin to morphine. Endocet 10/325 has worked best. There is enough oxycodone to control my pain, and I only take 2 tabs four times a day per doctor's order. Plus there is less acetmetaphen. I would highly recommend anyone with chronic pain to give it a try it.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The medication was very effective when I first started taking it however after just two weeks my body had developed a tolerance to the medication and it's effectiveness waned rapidly. My doctor increased y dosage from two pills a day to four pills a day then to six pills per day. Finally finding no further effectiveness for this drug I weaned my self down as far as I comfortably could but still suffered severe, long lasting agonizing withdrawl syptoms. I offer an extreme caution to anyone thinking about taking this medication that it is rapidly habit forming and when you discontinue using this medication prepare to suffer severe withdrawl symptoms. In summary, while this medication can be effective in relieving pain on a short term basis, any lng term use (30-60 days) will result in unwanted side effects which may out weigh the pain killing benefit received from the medication.
